name: 9.14 "Honor Thy Mother" Multiple Choice Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 9 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who got a coupon placed in a coupon book for Cheers?
questions.explanation:
Woody.

	Sam was angry about it. The coupon gave each person with it a free drink.

Carla.

	Woody told Carla her brother called with a message. Carla tore up Woody's paycheck thinking it was the message.

questions.text: Whose mother supposedly had "the death dream"?
questions.explanation:
Carla's.

	Carla said all the women in the family had "the death dream" right before they died. Carla did not like her mother however and didn't want to go see her even if she was dying.

Her sister.

	Carla didn't get along with her sister either. Sam pointed out earlier that Carla didn't get along with anyone. Carla replied, "That's not true, and shut up!".

questions.text: What happened to the ring that Carla's mother was going to give Carla?
options: She gave it to Carla's sister.
questions.explanation:
She hocked it.

	Her mother told her that since they made peace she wanted Carla to have her grandmother's ring. Then she told her she hocked it.

questions.text: What did Carla want her to rename one of her children?
questions.explanation:
Benito Mussolini.

	In Carla's family there was a tradition that when someone had a children they named one of them the first name of her father (Benito) and the middle name of her mother's maiden name (Mussolini). Carla refused to name her child Benito Mussolini because in history there was another Benito Mussolini who was a very bad man.

questions.text: Who volunteered to have his name changed?
questions.explanation:
Gino.

	Gino thought it would be cool to be named Benito Mussolini. He thought his nick name "Il duce" sounded really cool. Mussolini gave himself the title which meant "The Leader".

questions.text: Who carried Carla to her mother's house the 2nd time?
questions.explanation:
Sam and Gino.

	She went kicking and screaming. At one point she asked them to lift her a little higher. She said, "I'd like to have some butt left when I get there."

Carla's mother.

	Carla, upon her mother's death, vowed that her son Gino would be known as Benito Mussolini. Her mother then sat up saying that "it was about time, I was getting bedsores."

Yes.

	Carla said Gino had his named changed, but they called him Gino for short. Sam insulted Carla's mother and had to spend the night in the wall bed (with it up to the wall).
